comments:
I just added a library JAR to the root of a project and added this JAR as a library on the Java Build Path page. When clicking OK I got this exception:

java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:787)
at java.util.HashMap$ValueIterator.next(HashMap.java:817)
at java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableCollection$1.next(Collections.java:1010)
at org.openarchitectureware.core.internal.OawProject.analyze(OawProject.java:277)
at org.openarchitectureware.core.properties.MetamodelContributorsPropertyAndPreferencePage$4$1.execute(MetamodelContributorsPropertyAndPreferencePage.java:325)
at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:101)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1797)
at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:113)
at org.openarchitectureware.core.properties.MetamodelContributorsPropertyAndPreferencePage$4.run(MetamodelContributorsPropertyAndPreferencePage.java:329)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)
Addition: I also added the UML2 Metamodel Contributor at the same time. The bug is not safely reproducible, but adding both, a metamodel contributor and a jar, reproduces it mostly.

OawProject::analyze():
resources.values() was converted to an unmodifieable list, iterated over and analyzed all elements. With this the error was reproducible.

I copied resources.values() into a new list and iterated over this one, then the error is gone.
